title: Where 2 take my parents in Portland, OR
name: Where 2 take my parents in Portland, OR
description:
A Map by Sayumi

My parents r visiting Portland again!! This is the map of the fun places in Portland.
The place can be anywhere: parks, museums, street, area, gardens, restaurants, bars...

properties.name: 0009 walk stop 2 - piracy
properties.description: Posted by Hive    east side promenade, portland, or, under burnside bridgeThe location where, during the construction of the promenade itself, someone i know very well, comandeered an unattended cargo boat and took it for a joy ride up and down the river before leaving it parked at the pier on the other side of the river. "Construction started in October 1998. • The floating walkway is 1,200-feet long, 17-feet wide, and is the longest floating walkway in the United States. Poured concrete sections weigh 800,000 lbs. each. Sections were constructed in Bellingham, Wash., trucked to the construction site and floated into position. • The floating walkway includes a 120-foot dock constructed by the Portland Office of Transportation. The dock will provide a substantial amount of tie-up space for recreational boaters." -http://216.239.57.104/search?q=cache:VN3uJnSlJm4J:http://www.pdc.us/pdf/ura/central_eastside/factsheet.pdf+portland%20esplanade%20construction%20cost&hl=en&start=1&ie=UTF-8

properties.name: A Stroll Through The Roses
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor 400 SW Kingston Ave, Portland, ORTourists come in droves and locals take the kids to picnic at the stage area for after dinner ball playing and bubble blowing. Sayumi, your parents will like it I think.

properties.name: Another Garden with Rock Alcoves, Ducks and a Stream
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor  SE 28th Avenue, Portland, OR,Sayumi, these flowers are pervasive in portland and the garden is spectacular. Fun to feed the ducks here.

properties.name: Cathedral Park
properties.description: Posted by Phototron  Cathedral parkBeautiful park under the St. Johns bridge. You can easily walk up and down the river here.

properties.name: Gourmet Version of Portland Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor 10 SE 10th Ave., PortlandLocal, organic, delicious with a good wine list.

properties.name: Japanese Garden
properties.description: Posted by Janedoe    SW Kingston Avenue, Portland, OR

properties.name: Local Brothers Revitalize the Public House
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor5736 NE. 33rd Ave., Portland, OR, United StatesInteresting architecture- former school in this case with performance-filled gym, soaking pool, 2 restaurants, several small bars, each with their own character, microbrewery and even some guest rooms.

properties.name: OMSI
properties.description: Posted by Janedoe   1945 SE Water Avenue, Portland, OR,

properties.name: Oregon Zoo Max Station
properties.description: Posted by Jrkguy18Looking down the Robertson Tunnel east, trains approach and head west to Sunset Transit Center and beyond

properties.name: Portland City Grill
properties.description: Posted by Sayumi 111 Sw 5th Ave Ste 30, Portland, ORthis place is on the 30th floor of the building. great view in the night.

properties.name: Portland Rose Garden
properties.description: Posted by Bscoti400 SW Kingston Ave, Portland, ORRose Test garden with beautiful view of the downtown skyline

properties.name: The Farm
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor10 SE 10th Ave., PortlandPortlandesque - local, organic delicious food and charming ambience ;-)

properties.name: We found the brick!!
properties.description: Posted by SayumiWe found a brick that my parents bought 25 years ago. The brick was right in front of info center.

properties.name: zoobomb bike pile
properties.description: Posted by Jason join zoobombers every sunday for a fast ride down steep hills, meet in rocco\'s 8pm, ride 9pm
